comments:
Whenever I start editing the JSP files, eclipse starts consuming 90-100% CPU.
When I stop editing, it still consumes 90-100% for 2-3minutes and then goes back
to normal. But once when I start editing the CPU consumption starts once again.
This happens only in the JSP editor. It is making the whole eclipse unusable. I
just kill the process from task manager and restart eclipse.

I'm facing this problem WTP version 1.0M4 and upwards.

In M4:
In the progress view, "Update Progress and Animation Start" tasks never end at all.

In versions above M4(Integration builds):
In the progress view, "Processing Dirty Regions" task never end at all.

I'm not sure whether these tasks should end or not, but this is what I see in
the Progress View.

See also bug 100467. 

Thanks.

Actually, it was Phil that tracked down the Index.containerRelativePath
problem, so will attribute to him.
Please try in I-build > 6/17, and see bug 100467.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Please try in I-build > 6/17, and see bug 100467.

Hi,

 The M5 build was not having this issue at all. However, in the most recent
builds(after M5) I'm facing this issue once again. One good thing is that the
workbench does not get locked up like it was happening in Pre-M5 builds even
though the CPU consumption is more than 90%. This high CPU consumption happens
when "Processing Dirty Regions" and "Animation Start" processess are running. 

Sometimes I even get error when "Processing Dirty Regions" is running. Here is
the error log.
<ERROR_LOG>
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-07-11 17:56:17.328
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Processing Dirty Regions".
!STACK 0

I'm currently using 

eclipse-SDK-3.1-win32.zip
wtp-sdk-I20050712.zip
emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.1.0.zip
GEF-SDK-3.1.zip
VE-SDK-I20050710.zip(for JEM)

Pradeep

I actually have this problem (or a uncandidly similar one) with the M5 build
(using jdk1.5.0_03-b07 on linux (centos 4.0 and fedora 2))

eclipse-SDK-3.1-linux-gtk.tar.gz
emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-I200506230200.zip
GEF-SDK-3.1RC4.zip
JEM-SDK-I20050623.zip
wtp-1.0M5.zip

We are no longer using those reconciling strategies (from the stacktrace), we've
converted as you type validation to the "sourcevalidation" extention point.

I also haven't seen any of these problems testing recent builds.

Sorry to keep closing this, but that area of code has changed quite a bit
recently and should be performing better. 

Please reopen if you're still seeing this with a > 11/11 I build.

Thanks.
This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP resolved bugs from the 1.0.x and 1.5.0 timeframe.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti
